name: Residenz Stadslogement

reviews.text: Excellent location, spacious and comfortable. I stayed only one night but I felt at home and welcome. Delicious breakfast in the room, a lot of space and light, as well as all the niceties of a private apartment. I would recommend it without hesitation.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 2 night stay at The Residenz with my husband and our 2 year old son. It was a wonderful break and I will definitely return.
reviews.title: Wonderful find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is on a little square about a 10 min tram ride from the centre of town and in the other direction, about a 10 min tram ride to the beach. It's a residential part of town with a few little local shops a minute's stroll away.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: The room we stayed on was on the 1st floor overlooking the square. It was huge and accommodated all 3 of us with no problem. The bed is pretty much one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in with a remote control to raise head to your desired level. There's also a remote controlled real-look gas fire which made the room really cosy at night. There is a 'sitting room area' within the bedroom (all one big room) although we did see that the room on the other side of the landing had the 2 rooms split out (although that room had no fireplace or balcony).
reviews.title: a great little hotel

description: Residenz is located right in the heart of the lively Duinoord neighbourhood of the Hague, on the almond-shaped Sweelinckplein square. The house was built in 1895 in preparation for the arrival of former emigrants returning from the Indias. More than 110 years after it was built Residenz opens its doors as a Guest House. We are a boutique hotel with the charm of a homely bed and breakfast and are ready to welcome you as our guests and offer a memorable stay.
